post.description: Send all recipe templates of a cookbook to many devices.

message.example: Wrong device model: cookbook #{cookbook_name} has not been made for device #{device_serial}

get.description: Retry to send all cookbook's recipe templates to device

patch.description: Enable or disabled HACCP email notification every day at 7 UTC

enabled.description: whether email notification for HACCP is enabled or not

get.description: Get HACCP email notification status (enabled or disabled)

post.description:
Create a new device on things5. Name and machine_firmware_id are optional fields.
If used by admin users organization_id must be provided. If used by standard users machines_group_id is required.

Device manufactures should use a standard user to authenticate and create the device using machines_group_id

Please note that firmware id is not present because the machine should use Firmware version request to communicate the firmware version to things5

machine_model_id.description: Device model iD. Can be retrived using Machine models list

machine_firmware_id.description: Device firmware ID (must belong to the same model) (optional). Can be retrived using Machine firmwares list

organization_id.description: Required if user is admin. Can be retrived using Organizations list

machines_group_id.description: Required if user is not admin

parameters.description: Pagination parameter. If there are a lot of items only some will be present in data field. To get the remaining items repeat the API call using the after parameter present in the body of the previous request

parameters.description: Includues also machine model info in the response

put.description:
Generates a device certificate for an already created device on things5. Follow [Device create](ref:device-create) to create a new device.
On success returns a zip file containing the certificate files used to connect to the MQTT broker

BE CAREFUL:  Using this resource will invalidate all previous device certificates

format.description: can be "tar" or "tar.gz" otherwise zip will be used

post.description: Use this endpoint to send all the data that the device is generating: metrics, states and events.

get.description: Read state changes, like door open or cooling cycle from a specific device

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Pagination parameter. If there are a lot of items only some will be present in data field. To get the remaining items repeat the API call using the after parameter present in the body of the previous request

parameters.name: include_translations
parameters.description: wheter to include the translated name or not

get.description: Read state changes, like door open or cooling cycle from a specific device
Can be used to get a list of metrics values over time or a list of metrics last values.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Pagination parameter. If there are a lot of items only some will be present in data field. To get the remaining items repeat the API call using the after parameter present in the body of the previous request

parameters.name: last_value
parameters.description: Cannot be set if from/to are set. Pagination will not be present in the response

get.description: Read events, like pressure alarm or low power alert from a specific device

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Pagination parameter. If there are a lot of items only some will be present in data field. To get the remaining items repeat the API call using the after parameter present in the body of the previous request

parameters.name: severity[]
parameters.description: if missing return events with any severity, empty array only events without a severity. Values can be "alarm" "info" "warning"

put.description:
Generates a device certificate for an already created device on things5. Follow [Device create](ref:device-create) to create a new device.
On success returns a zip file containing the certificate files used to connect to the MQTT broker

BE CAREFUL:  Using this resource will invalidate all previous device certificates

format.description: can be "tar" or "tar.gz" otherwise zip will be used

get.description: This endpoint triggers Things5 to send mqtt messages to fetch device reipces
Sets the "synching" field to false
In the response there is a "synching" field and a "synced" field. The "synched" field is true if the machine has never been synched with things5

pending_update.description: wheter the recipe is being synched. False when device has processed update request

unique_id.description: Things5 unique id that reppresents a recipe in Things5

pending_update.description: wheter the recipe is being synched. False when device has processed update request

unique_id.description: Things5 unique id that reppresents a recipe in Things5

parameters.name: recipe_unique_id
parameters.description: this is the unique_id field, NOT the id

get.description: This can be useful when the recipes have been updated on Things5 triggering an update request to the device but the device has become unresponsive. In this case the "synching" field will remain true indefinitely. By canceling the update recipes request the "synching" and "synched" field will be set to false and all the recipes on Things5 will be removed.

post.description: The destination machine model must have a firmware marked as main

machine_model_id.description: the machine model id the machine will be changed to

users_create_child_roles.description: When creating a new user-machines-groups association these are the only roles the user is allowed to assign to the new user.

delete.description: Removes a user from device group. The user will not be deleted in things5

get.description: Returns the metrics aggregated using an aggregate function like average. If a time interval is provided data will be grouped according to it.

parameters.name: aggregate_interval_in_minutes
parameters.description: If provided group data according to it. If not provided reponse data will be a single value.

parameters.name: value_field
parameters.description: data on things5 is aggregated per minute. avg is the average of that minute, min is the min of that minute and so on. Increment is the increment relative to that previous minute.

get.description:
Immediately trigger the mqtt message to be sent to the machine. [read recipes request](ref:read-recipes-request)
Device must be connected in order to read recipes

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: timeout in milliseconds, no more than 60000

get.description:
Immediately trigger the mqtt message to be sent to the machine. [read recipe request](ref:read-recipe-request)
Device must be connected in order to read recipe

parameters.name: recipe_id
parameters.description: this id will be sent to the device. It can be anything

post.description:
Immediately trigger the mqtt message to be sent to the machine. [write recipe request](ref:write-recipe-request)
Device must be connected in order to write recipe. The device will handle the writing process, updating or creating the recipe. It should create a new recipe if no id is present and update it if id is present.

pending_update.description: wheter the recipe is being synched. False when device has processed update request

unique_id.description: Things5 unique id that reppresents a recipe in Things5

delete.description:
Immediately trigger the mqtt message to be sent to the machine. [delete recipe request](ref:delete-recipe-request)
Device must be connected in order to delete recipe

get.description: Given a list of machine_ids and a time interval returns the list of events

schema.default: Pagination parameter. If there are a lot of items only some will be present in data field. To get the remaining items repeat the API call using the after parameter present in the body of the previous request

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: limit the results in the response

parameters.name: severities[]
parameters.description: Filter by severities (alarm, warning, info). Default all severities

parameters.name: notifications_only
parameters.description: Return only events that the user has enabled as notification

post.description: Note that no message is sent to the device, the update is deleted only on things5 side

delete.description: Deleting a firmware is possible only if there are no entities associated with the firmware like machines, variables, translations. If other entities are associated the quickest way is to *archive* the firmware. The end result is similar to deleting firmware. It will be marked as archived and not shown anymore in the firmwares page. It won't be possible to associated it to a machine

message.example: are still associated with this entry

post.description: Archived firmwares won't be visible in the firmwares page and it won't be possible to associate them with a machine

patch.description: Note that to set main firmware you need to use [device model update](ref:device-model-update)

file.description: This file will be used when sending machine update request to the device

draft.description: if a firmware is draft only admins will be able to update a machine to this firmware
